title: WAF packages
description: Web Application Firewall (WAF) rule packages applied to a zone.
cfExtendedDescription: WAF packages are collections of WAF rule groups.

links.title: Get WAF packages
links.description: Fetches WAF packages for a zone.

name.description: The name of the WAF package.

page.description: The page number of paginated results.

per_page.description: The number of packages per page.

order.description: The field used to sort returned packages.

direction.description: The direction used to sort returned packages.

match.description: When set to `all`, all the search requirements must match. When set to `any`, only one of the search requirements has to match.

links.title: Get a WAF package
links.description: Fetches the details of a WAF package.

links.title: Update a WAF package
links.description: Updates a WAF package. You can update the sensitivity and the action of an anomaly detection WAF package.

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the WAF package.

action_mode.description: The default action performed by the rules in the WAF package.

links.response:
{
  "success": true,
  "errors": [],
  "messages": [],
  "result": {
    "id": "a25a9a7e9c00afc1fb2e0245519d725b",
    "name": "OWASP ModSecurity Core Rule Set",
    "description": "Covers OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities and more.",
    "detection_mode": "anomaly",
    "zone_id": "023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353",
    "status": "active",
    "sensitivity": "high",
    "action_mode": "challenge"
  }
}

id.description: The unique identifier of a WAF package.

name.description: The name of the WAF package.

description.description: A summary of the purpose/function of the WAF package.

detection_mode.description: The mode that defines how rules within the package are evaluated during the course of a request. When a package uses anomaly detection mode (`anomaly` value), each rule is given a score when triggered. If the total score of all triggered rules exceeds the sensitivity defined in the WAF package, the action configured in the package will be performed. Traditional detection mode (`traditional` value) will decide the action to take when it is triggered by the request. If multiple rules are triggered, the action providing the highest protection will be applied (for example, a 'block' action will win over a 'challenge' action).

status.description: When set to `active`, indicates that the WAF package will be applied to the zone.

id.description: The unique identifier of a WAF package.

name.description: The name of the WAF package.

description.description: A summary of the purpose/function of the WAF package.

detection_mode.description: When a WAF package uses anomaly detection, each rule is given a score when triggered. If the total score of all triggered rules exceeds the sensitivity defined on the WAF package, the action defined on the package will be taken.

status.description: When set to `active`, indicates that the WAF package will be applied to the zone.

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the WAF package.

action_mode.description: The default action performed by the rules in the WAF package.
